alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 03 at 4:32PM EDT until May 03 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL BROWN...NORTHWESTERN ADAMS AND EASTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES... At 432 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Highland Holiday, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Winchester, Marshall, Belfast, Rocky Fork Point, Highland Holiday, Emerald, Mowrystown, Sinking Spring, Rocky Fork Lake, Rainsboro, May Hill, Serpent Mound, Paint Creek State Park, Fincastle, Berrysville, Highland County Airport and Lake Waynoka. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
